poem:
Title: A Cry from the East

In the heart of dragon'sfolds, a scribe falls,
Swallowed by law's silent maw.
Promethean fire, she dared to fuel,
Sophia! Her name rings like a gong.
Five years cloaked in shadows long,
Justice, she claims. But to no avail.
In the prison's chill embraces,
her spirit breaks but never pales,
A distant echo from the Eastern jail.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Prominent China #MeToo journalist Sophia Huang Xueqin sentenced to five years in jail, supporters say A Chinese court has sentenced prominent #MeToo journalist Sophia Huang Xueqin to five years in jail and labour activist Wang Jianbing to three and a half years, almost 1,000 days after they were detained on allegations of inciting state subversion, according to supporters. On Friday, supporters of the pair said the court had found them guilty and delivered Huang the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
